title: Domain 4.1: Given a scenario, implement best practices associated with documentation and support systems information management.
content:
📝 Ticketing Systems – Best Practices

  • User Information: 👤 Name, contact, department – crucial for follow-up.
  • Device Information: 💻 Asset ID, model, OS – speeds up diagnosis.
  • Description of Problems: 🛠️ Clearly document the issue and replication steps.
  • Categories: 📂 Tag tickets (hardware, software, etc.) for proper routing.
  • Severity: 🚨 Indicates urgency and affects response time.
  • Escalation Levels: 📈 Defines when and where unresolved tickets go next.
  • Clear, Concise Written Communication: ✍️ Avoid jargon—make it understandable for all tech levels.

📄 Ticket Notes:

  • Problem Description: User's initial complaint.
  • Progress Notes: Troubleshooting steps taken.
  • Problem Resolution: Final solution for future reference.

🗃️ Asset Management

  • Inventory Lists: 📦 Track hardware/software organization-wide.
  • Database System: 🗄️ Centralized place for querying/updating asset info.
  • Asset Tags and IDs: 🏷️ Physical or digital identifiers for tracking.
  • Procurement Life Cycle: 🔄 Covers purchase to retirement stages.
  • Warranty and Licensing: 📜 Stay compliant and know expiration timelines.
  • Assigned Users: 🙋 Helps with accountability and support.

📑 Types of Documents

  • Acceptable Use Policy (AUP): 🔏 What users are allowed to do with tech.
  • Network Topology Diagram: 🗺️ Map of how everything’s connected.
  • Regulatory Compliance Requirements: ⚖️ Ensure you meet standards like HIPAA/GDPR.
  • Splash Screens: 📢 Login notices—often legal disclaimers.

🧾 Procedures and Support Docs

  • Incident Reports: 🛑 Log incidents for accountability and future improvement.
  • Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs): 📋 Detailed, repeatable task steps.
  • Custom Software Installation Procedures: 💿 Consistent config across machines.
  • New-User Setup Checklist: 👶 Equipment, access, onboarding tools.
  • End-User Termination Checklist: 🔒 Remove access, collect devices, secure data.

📚 Knowledge Base / Articles

Central repository of known fixes, FAQs, and how-to guides. Helps with self-service and onboarding.
